It’s an integrated set of technical products encapsulating critical enterprise capabilities, automated processes, and social architecture to enable high-velocity application development.   The PLATO team is comprised of engineers, problem solvers, agilists and creatives in roles such as Enterprise Platform Engineering and Architecture, Enterprise Data Services, Cloud Infrastructure and Architecture, Product Engineering, and Product Management. Together, the team provides the platform that enables the Bank to deliver transformative experiences that help our 24 million customers become better off.   Interested in joining an agile team that’s impacting change for our customers around the world? Watch our video.  The Software Engineering group  is looking for an energetic and results driven  Full Stack (Java/Angular 2.0/HTML5) Programmer Analyst Advisory preferably with experience in the financial industry.  This role is to support a web based application that provides our business users the means of  remediating data quality issues so as to ensure the data our business partners use for their required job function is accurate  and  remediated in a quick and timely manor. The successful applicant will work in the Programmer Analyst Advisory role, developing solutions and supporting production, resulting in a positive impact to the team and Bank as a whole. The ability to manage multiple tasks with changing priorities within tight time-frames is required for this position. To be successful, the individual must thrive on challenge, be proactive, eager to learn, and be attentive to detail.   •Application analysis and design, and development for the Governace console web application, the supporting web services and reporting services. 
•Assist technical resources in the analysis of business requirements in order to establish the technical feasibility of proposed initiatives 
•Responsible for the assessment and scoping of projects (from a development work effort perspective). 
•Excellent verbal and written communication skills   
•Ensure a timely delivery of quality products/functions which meet end-user requirements and that are developed following BNS development standards and methodology; 
•Responsible for performance analysis (from an application and environment perspective) and make recommendations to improve operational effectiveness 
 Work in a development team comprising both BNS staff and external consulting resources as required; 
•Deal effectively with external vendors, external business partners, and internal stake holders 
 Must be able to work within tight deadlines and schedules which may result in external work hours to meet project deliverables 
•Joining bridge calls to address production issues 
•Carrying a production support pager for after-hours support and 
•Investigating customer support issues.       Experience Requirements    
• 3 to 5 years software development experience 
• 1 to 3 years’ experience in the financial industry 
• 3+ years’ experience in Java, Angular 2.0, and HTML5 Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
